FESTI.IC.summary: Festi hf., together with its subsidiaries, engages in the retail sale of fuel in Iceland. It operates through KrÃ³nan, N1, and ELKO segments. The company operates 68 fuel service stations, 11 electricity service stations in co-operation with ON, and one methane service station for vehicles; 27 service stations that offer refreshments and healthy snacks under the Nesti brand; 11 lubrication and tyre garages; and six corporate stores and 52 maritime fuel pumps. It also operates 22 convenience stores under the KrÃ³nan and Kr brand names; two convenience stores under the Kjarval brand name; a store under the NÃ³atÃºn brand name; five electronic stores under the Elko brand name, as well as an online store; and a warehouse hotel that provides product storage, packing, labelling, and product distribution services under the Bakkinn brand. It also leases non-residential real estate properties. The company was formerly known as N1 hf. and changed its name to Festi hf. in September 2018. Festi hf. is headquartered in Kopavogur, Iceland.

HAMP.IC.summary: Hampidjan Hf. manufactures and sells fishing nets, ropes, and fishing long lines for the fishing fleet in Iceland. The company offers fishing products, including trawls, trawl doors, purse seines, warps and ropes, data, and netting products, as well as various hardware used for fishing. It also provides ropes for yachting, off road, military, and offshore applications; towing solutions comprising separation and wide tow ropes, and deflector straps; mooring ropes for wire replacement; towing ropes for harbor towing, harbor tugging, and open sea and emergency towing; lifting products; and ropes and nets for sports. The company was founded in 1934 and is headquartered in Reykjavik, Iceland.

KALD.IC.summary: KaldalÃ³n hf. operates as a real estate development company in Iceland. It engages in the construction of residential real estate projects. The company is based in ReykjavÃ­k, Iceland.

SKEL.IC.summary: Skeljungur hf., together with its subsidiaries, imports, distributes, and sells oil, lubricants, chemical products, and fertilizers. The company is also involved in the retail and wholesale trade of other commodities. In addition, it engages in lending and other activities; and operates real estate properties, as well as vessels and service stations. The company operates a network of 65 gas stations, including 48 Orkan, 9 Skeljungur, and 8 Orkan X stations, as well as 4 oil depots in Iceland; and 11 retail and fuel stations, and 2 oil depots in the Faroe Islands. Skeljungur hf. was founded in 1928 and is based in ReykjavÃ­k, Iceland.
